html: thou hast made of a city an heap. City here refers to all cities wherein wickedness reigns. It is found in the singular form, perhaps recalling the ancient city of Babylon, which represents worldliness (D&C 1:16). Here Isaiah tells us that God will make a city into a heap of stones and rubble, and a fortified city into a ruin. This is one of the reasons why we will praise God's name.
